review: I would have given 4 stars if it was better at picking up a signal from ALL wireless devices.  Fortunately I have an access point ASUS in the same room.  Otherwise, you should have a strong signal router to use this for streaming.  I also have a roku3 which works much more consistently in wireless mode.  For half the price, it's a good deal though.  Also great for traveling.
author: John J Hair III

review: I have several Roku devices and have always been very satisfied until I bought the "stick". First, it performs all the functions I have come to expect from Roku - so don't get me wrong, it streams Netflix and all the other streaming media just fine - but I already had 3 other Roku models that did the same thing.  So why did I buy the stick anyway? Well it looked like it would be handy to use while I was traveling - just plug it into the back of my hotel tv and away you go... not so fast.... it seems you have to plug the Stick into a power source; so you have this very handy device encumbered by a power cable - the only power outlets neat the hotel tv are behind the cabinet and all in use, so you need an extension cord (probably a long one) to reach an outlet elsewhere in the room... that was more hassle than using my Roku 3.  The other reason I bought the Stick was to stream video directly from my tablet or phone to the TV. It turns out that unless you have an Ipad, the Stick works with a very small list of Android devices.No portability advantage and no streaming from my tablet - I'm not impressed.
author: J. F Jones "ballast"

review: I had two traditional Rokus and got this one for my bedroom. I did buy an HDMI multi-plug so that I could use both HDMI outputs on the back of my TV.This stick is also very handy to take with me when I travel.
